I have a couple of queries however.

I figure that WS/EWS is not really needed due to the high strength, although I can fit it in with a loss of 80hp (Toughness, Epic Toughness).  I figure the HP are more useful.

The other is a toss up between Toughness, Improved Expertise and Improved KD.  I can only fit in 2 of the three, and am leaning towards Toughness and IE but, considering I am using a shield is it worth taking IKD instead ?

Thanks for your help !


PS:  Which option do you choose to put the build in a spoiler tag, nothing seemed to jump out at me ?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Epic Toughness gives you 20 health, so losing Toughness + Epic Toughness costs you 60 health, not 80. In exchange, you would get + 6 damage on every hit, which would be tripled on critical hits along with the rest of the damage.
I would go for Improved Knockdown over Improved Expertise because it makes your knockdown harder to resist
To put stuff in a spoiler, type (spoiler) before and (/spoiler) after, but use square brackets [] instead of parentheses (). This works in most forums, not only this one.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Hi Kalistez! I would not give HPs priority here.
I agree with you taking Improved Expertise, if nothing else, at least to prevent being crit'ed in a dev crit environment.
EWS is always an option, and especially so in a low magic environment where weapon enhancements are low. Here you will survive ok without, because of the high strength, but you might still want it.
I take KD all the time.  IKD is imo more to compensate for low AB or small stature.
The disarm feats can be great here in this high AB build.

A weakness of WM builds is the low fort save. And that hurts in a dev crit environment. Save enhancing feats can help some, but won't cure it completely.
Mith put it this way in the thread you linked to: "I didn't build this character for a devastating critical server, nor would I play him on one. His AC isn't high enough and his fortitude save isn't good enough to survive against devastating critical. The improved expertise choice is mostly a PvM choice. With improved expertise his AB drops to 42, that is about the same as most rogues and even some melee builds, so when you add in magical equipment it is good enough to hit with. By the same token his AC increases to monk and PM levels making him much harder to hit. One on one, it is better to fight without expertise mode. Against multiple enemies, improved expertise can be a life saver. PvP, the disarm feats would probably be better."
